dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Tell me about your missing coworker.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Braxton. He's in charge of getting the fish fat but also making sure they don't get too many tumors.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: He's a real wizard with pharmaceuticals, but he has creative notions of working hours. Comes with living in a "free" colony, I guess.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: He'll come back eventually. You can't constrain a person's freedom.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't you have rules about that sort of thing?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you say so.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So find him and drag him out by his ears!

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: I can't keep working double shifts, either.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Since you don't seem to be constrained yourself, maybe you could check up on him. He lives in the apartments.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Tell him Velma said to get his lazy ass down here, or she might start noticing those extra drugs he's been taking from supply.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Something else on your mind?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You said Braxton had been stealing drugs?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll talk to you later.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Stealing's such a nasty word. Let's call it skimming.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: And yeah, let's just say I've noticed the sterobiotics we use for the fish would get used a little faster on Braxton's shifts.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Awfully nice of you not to say anything.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why didn't you turn him in?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You should've hung that sleazebag out to dry.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: We're not like those corporate towns where you get fined for sleeping on the wrong side of the bed.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Besides, the Spacer's Choice stuff we use is cheap enough. And Braxton knows how to get the saltuna fat and mostly tumor-free.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: Someone would've if this were a corporate town. But we pride ourselves on giving people a little breathing room.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: We're not keen on rules for rules' sake around here. Means Braxton skips work sometimes, but it also means no company boss is telling me when I can take a shit.

dialog.speaker: velmaballard (Female)
dialog.utterance: I would if I weren't busy here picking up his slack.
